intro: Psychotria tayabensis var. fasciculiflora, commonly known as the Yucatán psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Yucatán Peninsula in Mexico and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and undergrowth. It has a woody stem and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. This variety is notable for its morphological distinctiveness within the Psychotria genus.
